image.altText: A composite image of two men, both wearing black sunglasses, walking outdoors looking serious.

props.synopsis: Lawyers for a Canberra man charged with raping a teenager in 2022 have told a jury there is a real chance if found guilty he would be taking the fall for someone else.

title.children: Canberra man on trial for raping teenage girl calls co-accused a 'liar'

image.altText: a close-up of someone using an iphone to purchase alcohol online

props.synopsis: The ACT government introduces a bill that would restrict alcohol deliveries to Canberra homes to between 10am and 10pm, and cap the amount of alcohol a consumer could receive in a 24-hour period.

title.children: Alcohol deliveries to Canberra homes could soon be restricted

image.altText: Gungahlin United Football Club

props.synopsis: Families have been left "totally blindsided" by the closure of Gungahlin United Football Club, as the club's debts more than double to $550,000.

title.children: 'Shattered': 2,000 players left stranded as football club's debt doubles

image.altText: The ACT Supreme Court towards dusk.

props.synopsis: A Canberra man has pleaded guilty to his part in a "cruel" and "premeditated" attack on a woman, helping trick her into a car before driving her around, hitting her with a baseball bat, choking her and demanding $10,000.

title.children: Canberra man jailed for part in brutal baseball bat attack

image.altText: A render of the new UNSW Canberra buildings

props.synopsis: Once complete, the new UNSW campus will be an education hub for thousands of students and staff, and is expected to provide a much-needed injection to the city's economy.

title.children: First look at UNSW's $1b Canberra campus expansion

image.altText: A man wearing a navy suit and glasses stands behind a podium looking serious.

props.synopsis: The ACT's chief minister brushes off criticism that his government is "tired", but acknowledges the 12 months since the election have been "difficult" for the territory.

title.children: It has been a 'challenging first year' in minority government, says Barr

image.altText: a man pulls a snake from its tail

props.synopsis: A passenger in a car has the fright of his life when a tiger snake slithers across his feet during a drive on the NSW far south coast.

title.children: 'Hell of a fright': Snake slithers over man's foot on drive to the shops

image.altText: Bonnie Jantke looks down as she plays piano.

props.synopsis: Many people struggle to approach the subject of death with family, and what kind of care they want to receive in their final months or years.

title.children: The conversation families avoid, and why it matters when time runs out

image.altText: People at beach

props.synopsis: Temperatures are soaring in NSW, while Victorian and South Australian residents are bracing for powerful wind gusts on a day of wild weather.

title.children: Temperatures soar in NSW while cyclone-strength winds batter Vic, SA

image.altText: A person filling a glass with water from a tap

props.synopsis: Many people would say the benefits of fluoride in water are clear but in this state it's often not there and there will be lasting health impacts.

title.children: 'The Queensland smile' to live on as fluoride is removed from water

image.altText: Greg Walker

props.synopsis: The boy's mother Julie Szabo watched on as her son's killer uttered the words "I'm guilty", 27 years after her teenage son died in a firebombing in Sydney's Waterloo.

title.children: Man pleads guilty to 1998 housefire death of teen at sleepover

image.altText: A man with hiking gear and sunglasses crouches in front of a cliff overlooking a river.

props.synopsis: A body, believed to be that of missing bushwalker Daryl Fong, has been found after more than a week of searching in Mount Field National Park.

title.children: Tasmania Police find body believed to be missing bushwalker

image.altText: Brown paddock aerial photo with fence line

props.synopsis: The federal government grants major project status to a joint Australian-US mine in regional Victoria.

title.children: Controversial rare earth mine in Victorian town fast-tracked by government deal

image.altText: A man holds up a phone while he takes a selfie.

props.synopsis: A NSW man has claimed to be an admiral for 25 years while peddling a disaster relief scheme, but he has never served in the navy.

title.children: Colourful past of 'admiral' peddling disaster relief scheme exposed

image.altText: A middle-aged, grey-haired man in a police uniform stands in front of a Victroia Police backdrop.

props.synopsis: The chief commissioner of Victoria Police says the use of a police helicopter for a work trip to Tasmania "creates a poor impression".

title.children: Victoria's top cop sorry for using police chopper to fly to Tasmania

image.altText: Jason Sourasis

props.synopsis: The former financial adviser to Collingwood star Scott Pendlebury has racked up a multi-million dollar tax debt since 2021.

title.children: Sports business mogul facing multi-million-dollar tax debt

image.altText: A painting of a large echidna, kangaroo, thylacine and wombat-like creature in an eucalypyt forest.

props.synopsis: Palaeontologists say there is no hard evidence in the fossil record that extinct Australian megafauna were butchered by First Nations people.

title.children: Did humans kill Australia's ancient megafauna? Bone study prompts rethink

image.altText: close up image of bus odometer

props.synopsis: Odometer fraud is "widespread" in the second-hand car industry, but experts say there are warning signs to look for when buying a used car.

title.children: How used-car buyers can protect themselves from odometer tampering

image.altText: A female golfer at the end of a swing on a leafy course.

props.synopsis: Minjee Lee, Hannah Green and Grace Kim will lead a powerful Australian line-up at the prestigious women's golf's International Crown team event in South Korea.

title.children: Aussie team to feature three major winners at International Crown

image.altText: Man in blue jumper and black bucket had smiles to the camera.

props.synopsis: Some Australians would rather stay home and talk to an AI bot than go out with friends, according to a YouGov survey.

title.children: 'A great friend': Young Australians on their relationships with AI chatbots

image.altText: Talia Scriven sits amongst brown reeds wearing large rattan earrings and a beige jacket. She has brown hair.

props.synopsis: A first-of-its-kind South Australian study finds access to compensation after a road accident is not good enough for First Nations people.

title.children: Road accident compensation not culturally safe, study says

image.altText: An apprentice electrician working with a wire.

props.synopsis: One in eight electrical apprentices are being exposed to potentially deadly shocks at work, as the industry struggles with worker shortages, inadequate support and delays in training.

title.children: Electrical apprentices exposed to potentially deadly shocks on the job

image.altText: A woman with short hair and blue blazer claps while on stage behind a lecturn holding a microphone.

props.synopsis: An MP says new donation caps on political groups such as Climate 200 mean the days of independents spending up to $2 million on election campaigns are "gone".

title.children: Unsuccessful independent's $2m campaign spend the highest in Australia

image.altText: A ghost white tree trunk, sitting on white sand on a beach.

props.synopsis: Shane Batham confidentially settles a court action against the operators of Hamilton Island over claims that an art class reproduced his photos without permission.

title.children: Photographer takes on wealthy island operators over art classes

image.altText: close up of critical mineral gallium

props.synopsis: Australian critical minerals companies could expect more international and domestic investment in producing and processing following the deal, experts say, however, more investment is needed in refineries and magnet production.

title.children: Critical minerals deal tipped to unlock Australia's 'next chapter of prosperity'

image.altText: A women with short dark hair and glasses looks seriously at the camera.

props.synopsis: IUDs can be inserted by GPs, gynaecologists and family planning doctors, but in Alice Springs there aren't enough local professionals trained to do so.

title.children: Women waiting months, considering interstate travel for birth control

image.altText: An aerial photo of a new housing estate with empty blocks and several new houses being built.

props.synopsis: Industry experts warn – despite improvements – Australia will fail to meet its housing targets if skills shortages and regulatory barriers are not addressed.

title.children: Building a house in Australia is slower than it was a decade ago

image.altText: Two young males watch the large swell at Clovelly Beach Sydney

props.synopsis: As Sydney prepares to swelter, the city's beaches have been graded — and two local government areas dominate the list for cleanliness.

title.children: Sydney's cleanest and most polluted beaches revealed

image.altText: A wombat wearing a harness and lead. He is standing between a woman's legs.

props.synopsis: Gundy the wombat suffered vision loss after his mother was killed by a car while he was in her pouch. Wildlife carers are finding creative ways to give him a new chance at life.

title.children: Wildlife carers help blind baby wombat adapt to new home

image.altText: A young woman sits in hospital after suffering a skull fracture.

props.synopsis: After surviving a car crash and a stroke, Laura McKenney was told she may never walk again. Now, she's trekking 50-kilometres to raise money for the service that saved her life.

title.children: Family of crash survivor who learnt to walk again urges drivers to wear seatbelts

image.altText: A dark-haired, bearded man in a dark suit stands in front of some microphones.

props.synopsis: The vice-president urged Israel to have "a little bit of patience" with Hamas as the militant group tries to find the remains of deceased hostages.

title.children: Gaza ceasefire going 'better than expected', JD Vance says

image.altText: Mark Nawaqanitawase  looks to his right during a Roosters' NRL match.

props.synopsis: Ex-Wallabies winger Mark Nawaqanitawase and Reece Walsh are among four players named to make their debuts for Australia in the opening Ashes rugby league Test against England.

title.children: Nawaqanitawase becomes dual international as Kangaroos name Test squad

image.altText: CCTV footage of a man wearing a gas mask using a sledgehammer to break through glass

props.synopsis: The theft of several royal treasures at the Louvre on Monday was not the first museum jewellery heist this century to resemble a Hollywood movie. Here's a look back at two infamous capers to steal near-priceless jewels.

title.children: Before the Louvre, these were the biggest heists of the 21st century

image.altText: Darwin Harbour InpexLNGLiquified Natural Gas

props.synopsis: The NT government has opened an investigation into oil and gas giant Inpex after the company admitted it has been under-reporting potentially toxic emissions from its flagship Ichthys LNG plant on Darwin Harbour.

title.children: Gas giant Inpex under investigation after admitting to emissions error

image.altText: Nicolas Sarkozy waves to the crowd, walking next to wife Carla Bruni.

props.synopsis: Former French president Nicolas Sarkozy is due to start serving a five-year sentence in prison, after being convicted of criminal conspiracy over a plan for late Libyan dictator Muammar Gaddafi to fund his electoral campaign.

title.children: Fall from grace as Sarkozy trades the Élysée Palace for a prison cell
